intro: Hieronymiella cardenasii, commonly known as the Cienega daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, tubular florets that are typically clustered in a daisy-like arrangement. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species in desert environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
